name: Erik Jan van Leeuwen
content: Homepage of Erik Jan van Leeuwen Homepage of Erik Jan van Leeuwen Assistant Professor at Utrecht University, The Netherlands Home / Contact Publications CV Essentials Browse my publications and curriculum vitae. My main research interests are: graph algorithms, parameterized algorithms, computational complexity, approximation algorithms, computational geometry, network science, graph neural networks. Recently (last updated: November 2025) Participated in the UU outreach program Talks around town and spoke to visitors of the Utrecht public library about my research. Paper accepted to ACM Transactions on Algorithms: Planar Multiway Cut with Terminals On Few Faces, with Sukanya Pandey. Program committee co-chair for IPEC 2025. Program committee member for STOC 2026. Became Chair of the IPEC Steering Committee. Paper accepted at ICAIF 2025: LAS-GNN: A Graph Neural Network for Temporal Money Laundering Motif Detection, with Stan Verlaan and Ioana Hulpuș. Poster accepted to Netsci 2025: When do Faster Algorithms to Computer Network Diameter Exist?. Invited speaker at SOFSEM 2025. Invited paper in the proceedings on Open Problems and Recent Developments on a Complexity Framework for Forbidden Subgraphs. Contact E-mail:e.j.vanleeuwen@uu.nl Mail address:Utrecht UniversityDept.
